messages.message: Who worked on the “Validate” button for the review-ocr screen? I’m having some trouble getting it to work properly
cc @dlluncor
Yep whatsup? Also @Eric Han will have context on it more and more btw

I get a “Could not read from binary path” error message when trying to use it: https://www.instabase.com/apps/ocr/review-doc/MetLife2020/MetLife/fs/Metlife%20Drive/IB_pilot/workspace-chetan/templates/homecare/varun/demo_samples/out/s5_merge_files/out.ibocr?i=1&ibflowresults=
@dlluncor @Eric Han IB ID so that I can share the repo?
it’s erich for me
added @Eric Han
@Chetan can you link me to the refiner that generated this?
dlluncor for me
added @dlluncor
https://www.instabase.com/apps/refiner-v5/edit/MetLife2020/MetLife/fs/Metlife%20Drive/IB_pilot/workspace-chetan/templates/homecare/master_refiner.ibrefiner# @Eric Han
i’m tinkering with the refiner a bit now FYI so pls don’t save.

so relative_binary_path in the refined_payload->run_refiner_params part of the IBOCR is not filled in. https://instabase.com/MetLife2020/MetLife/fs/Metlife%20Drive/IB_pilot/workspace-chetan/templates/homecare/varun/demo_samples/out/s5_merge_files/out.ibocr?content-disposition=raw

this means that either 1) there is a bug in Apply Refiner with ibprog (i think unlikely) or 2) there is a bug with filling in the relative_binary_path when an ibrefiner file is being used, which seems more likely. Were you using an ibrefiner file?
@Chetan
the relative_binary_path in the IBOCR’s refined_payload->run_refiner_params is what is needed to re-run the Apply Refiner step for validation
yes i was. should i export as ibprog and try to run it? @dlluncor
that could be a workaround yep @Chetan. Think it’d be good to file this bug for Doc Insight to remediate as well
i’ll file it once i confirm this works, thanks @dlluncor

@dlluncor re-ran with classic refiner, same problem: https://instabase.com/apps/text-editor/MetLife2020/MetLife/fs/Metlife%20Drive/IB_pilot/workspace-chetan/templates/homecare/varun/demo_samples/run_chetan/2020-04-16-02:56:47/6f970179-b590-4e6e-a9d3-426bb8255203/out/s5_merge_files/out.ibocr
could you send me to the link where you are running this @Chetan?
and how you are running it
https://instabase.com/apps/flow/edit/MetLife2020/MetLife/fs/Metlife%20Drive/IB_pilot/workspace-chetan/templates/flows/homecare.ibflow#
just running it with tools > run with “compile and run as binary” with “output as run id” also enabled and “use new flow format” enabled

https://instabase.com/MetLife2020/MetLife/fs/Metlife%20Drive/IB_pilot/workspace-chetan/templates/homecare/varun/new_data_set2-chetan/iteration-round-2/ i’d run in this data, it’ll take less time @dlluncor
changing it to one file
so that I can test a bit easier — give me a few mins, still looking into it

OK — think I got it. When I do “Compile and Run as Binary” it seems to be using Flow V1 instead of Flow V2 code. @abhilash @Karthik S could you assist into why this might be? I know there were some changes made here recently

When running in Flow V1, validation won’t work @Chetan. My current recommendation is to compile it as a binary, and then run that binary as a second step. For some reason the “Compile and Run as Binary” doesn’t seem to run it as a binary on instabase.com (http://instabase.com)
well that explains this too: https://instabase.slack.com/archives/CV8V33RPV/p1585629351038800 @dlluncor lol
but got it — thanks @dlluncor

I had a syntax error in my refiner program — it was preventing compilation and so flow was falling back to V1. The program executed fine though (except for that one column, where I knew the syntax error existed and didn’t care). Maybe we should just no longer fall back to Flow V1 and surface the compilation error? @dlluncor
Fascinating. Where did the compilation error happen? @Chetan. As in, I'm not aware of a Flow V2 to Flow V1 fallback mechanism. Would need @abhilash or @Karthik S there
If we cant compile, it falls back to V1 . This is as designed for v1 to v2 migration. We could throw an error instead of fall back to v1 is compile_and_run_as_binary is set
@dlluncor it happened implicitly i assume with “compile and run as binary” and was suppressed. It happened explicitly and was shown when I went to “Flow > Compile” and tried compiling the program.
yea — would be a good idea i think @Karthik S
